text: Bagdadia khaoensis is a moth in the family Gelechiidae. It was described by Kyu-Tek Park and Margarita Gennadievna Ponomarenko in 1999. It is found in Thailand and Hainan, China.Yang, M-Q. & Li, H-H. (2015). "A taxonomic study of the genus Bagdadia Amsel, 1949 from Hainan Island of China (Lepidoptera: Gelechiidae)". Zootaxa. 3972 (4) 589-594. The length of the forewings is 8-9.5 mm. The ground colour of the forewings, as well as the markings are identical to those of Bagdadia salicicola. The hindwings are grey.Species Diversity. 4: 334. The larvae feed on Dimocarpus longan. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1999 Category:Bagdadia
title: Bagdadia khaoensis
